activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marissa J. Carlson

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM Defendant Marissa J. Carlson in court.  Attorney Michael William Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Schiek has spoke with Defendant. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Defendant willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Defendant to contact DA's office to set up appointment. Bond continued. adj. 02:00 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:09 PM Defendant Marissa J. Carlson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court statement to status of counsel - Defendant statement- Defendant waives counsel.  Court reads on waiver of counsel.  Waiver free and voluntary.  
Court will set for preliminary hearing. Court directs def. to contact DA. Schiek.
Bail continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marissa J. Carlson in court. 
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel.  Gives statement still trying to come up with retainer. Also checking with other attorneys.
Bail continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marissa J. Carlson in court. Court states Defendant is not eligible for PD or Court appointed counsel. Defendant has contacted Attorney Gary Cirilli - needs to get enough for retainer. Bond continued. adj. 03:10 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marissa J. Carlson in court. Court states Defendant not eligible for PD - applied for Court appointed counsel - does not qualify. Court will set out. Bond continued. adj. 02:37 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - DENIED

2:45 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marissa J. Carlson in court. 
Defendant has not yet obtained counsel. Not eligible for PD but has petition for COA
Bail continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Marissa J. Carlson appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Court verifies Defendant's address/household/employment. Court sets bond. adj. 1:48 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
